author: customer
text: I'm so disappointed to be writing this review. I had trouble from the beginning to end with my purchase. When I originally went to check out, the website kept backfiring on me and did not accept my credit card, paypal or debit card. It also did not accept any coupon code I used, even though all were eligible. Once I received my item after fast shipping, I realized I accidentally purchased the wrong bag. It was my fault for not reading the description closely enough, but there was also a glitch in the website that customer service did not take responsibility for. I kindly asked for at least store credit back and none of my requests were met. I don't think I'll be returning, unfortunately.
title: I'm so disappointed to be writing this…

author: Not very happy consignor
text: I’m very disappointed in the RealReal’s consignment process. Someone came to my house to go through my items. They took almost 60 items, left a few behind. Now they’ve returned most to me in SIX different shipments - so far. I don’t mind them not accepting the items, but they should train their employees better so they don’t ship back so much. They don’t take most Tory Burch, Trina Turk, Elie Tahiti, etc. and their employees should know that. It’s ridiculous and a waste of time and money - incredibly inefficient. I’m going to make so little from what they kept, I might as well have donated the clothes to Goodwill in the first place
title: What a waste of time!!!

author: Customer
text:
Two of the items in my order were great, two were just ok, one was not good and two were completely wrong out of my first order alone. 

The two items that were wrong / wildly different from how posted/portrayed could have been easily avoided with more diligent intake and accurate posting. 

I received one ladies item that was very clearly four sizes different than listing in an unmistakable way and one item that was men’s instead of women’s. Both were shoes had been mis-listed in terms of size/categories type details and shoes are not like a garment in terms of ability to do alterations.

With improvement I think this could be a good site. 

They should revise their return policy so customers are not charged return shipping in cases where we received a wrong/completely mis-represented item different from listing. 

I understand return shipping in a case where customer simply decided they didn’t like fit of item etc, but not when the problem was from the company side and a wrong/different item/mis-represented item is sent. 

Company needs to get better at reading tags and listing more accurately.
title: Has a lot of potential but needs quality control and intake improvements

author: customer
text: The sparse description of items leaves something to be desired. I'm also concerned about their inspection process, as the pair of boots I ordered had a broken zipper which was not mentioned in the listing. Now I have to pay to return both things, neither of which I would have ordered if the listings had been more complete.
